Evolution of Time Series Forecasting: From Traditional Methods to Latest AI Models

TimeSeriesForecasting MachineLearning DeepLearning Transformer LLM AI PredictiveModels

üìñ Table of Contents

  • Series Plan
  • Technology Timeline
  • Series Plan and Flow
  • Learning Objectives
  • Application Areas

üöÄ Series Plan

I've planned a 5-step series to systematically learn the development process of time series forecasting technology.

üí° Learning Goals

Starting from ARIMA, through Prophet, N-BEATS, Transformer-based models, and up to the latest TimeGPT and Lag-Llama, I'll learn step by step to understand the overall flow of time series forecasting.

‚è∞ Technology Timeline

I've organized the development process of time series forecasting technology by year.

1970s-1990s

üîÑ Traditional Statistical Methods

ARIMA, SARIMA, Exponential Smoothing

  • Linearity assumption
  • Stationarity requirement
  • Manual parameter tuning
2010s

üìä Modern Statistical Methods

Prophet, GARCH, Structural Models

  • Automatic seasonality handling
  • Volatility modeling
  • Exogenous variable utilization
2015-2020

üß† Deep Learning Introduction

LSTM, GRU, N-BEATS, DeepAR

  • Non-linear pattern learning
  • Automatic feature extraction
  • Probabilistic forecasting
2020-2023

‚ö° Transformer Revolution

Informer, Autoformer, FEDformer

  • Long time series processing
  • Attention mechanism
  • Efficient learning
2023-Present

ü§ñ Time Series LLM Era

TimeGPT, Lag-Llama, Moirai

  • Large-scale pre-training
  • Few-shot learning
  • Natural language interface

üìö Series Plan and Flow

A systematic learning path consisting of 5 steps.

1

üìñ Part 1: Fundamentals of Time Series Forecasting

From ARIMA to Prophet

  • Understanding time series data characteristics
  • Principles of traditional statistical methods
  • Prophet's emergence and advantages
2

üß† Part 2: Emergence of Deep Learning

N-BEATS and DeepAR

  • Neural network-based time series models
  • N-BEATS structure and advantages
  • DeepAR's probabilistic approach
3

‚ö° Part 3: Transformer Revolution

Informer and Autoformer

  • Transformer architecture application
  • Informer's efficient processing
  • Autoformer's automatic decomposition
4

ü§ñ Part 4: Time Series LLM Era

TimeGPT and Lag-Llama

  • Large-scale time series models
  • TimeGPT structure and performance
  • Lag-Llama characteristics
5

üéØ Part 5: Practical Application and AutoML

From Darts to AutoML

  • Darts library utilization
  • PyCaret automation
  • Real data application

üéØ Learning Objectives

Goals I want to achieve through this series.

üìä

Theoretical Understanding

  • Mathematical characteristics of time series data
  • Principles and assumptions of each model
  • Model comparison and selection criteria
üíª

Practical Implementation Skills

  • Python-based model implementation
  • Data preprocessing and pipelines
  • Hyperparameter tuning
üöÄ

Latest Trend Awareness

  • Latest trends in AI/ML field
  • Transformer and LLM utilization
  • AutoML and automation trends
üéØ

Practical Application

  • Testing models with real data
  • Performance evaluation and comparison
  • Working on personal projects

üè¢ Application Areas

Major industries where time series forecasting is applied.

üí∞ Finance and Investment

  • Stock price and exchange rate forecasting
  • Risk management and VaR calculation
  • Credit evaluation and default prediction

üè≠ Manufacturing and Logistics

  • Demand forecasting and inventory management
  • Equipment maintenance prediction
  • Supply chain optimization

üõí Retail and Services

  • Revenue and customer behavior forecasting
  • Workforce allocation and scheduling
  • Marketing campaign effect prediction

‚ö° Energy and Infrastructure

  • Power demand forecasting
  • Renewable energy production prediction
  • Traffic volume and air quality forecasting

üöÄ Start Learning Now

Now let's build the foundation of time series forecasting!

üìñ Part 1: Fundamentals of Time Series Forecasting

From ARIMA to Prophet, systematically learn the core of traditional statistical methods and implement them with actual code.
